page.title: 20FARMING, West Cambridgeshire
page.content:
Most of land in survey area is arable, main crops cereals/potatoes/energy-pro ducing oil seed rape, lupins. Little old pasture - most land ploughed by Government order during World War 2.
In 1930s all farms had milking herds (smallholders 1 cow), now no dairy farms, in fact little livestock. Catworth - Horses bred. Sheep grazed (meat/wool). Pigs. Beef unit Grange Fm 200 head fed winter haylage, stored in silos, animals fed automatically.
Most farms owned privately, some at Leighton and Lt.Catworth by Church Com missioners. Effect of over-production of grain and nature conservation means hedgerows (removed to make way for larger farm machinery) now being re- placed, woodland planted, ponds dug.
